website_summaries.verdict: Huge attic fan that delivers the performance and durability you need.
pros: Ships with everything you need for mounting it
Perfect choice for attic ventilation in areas where wiring is not easily accessible
Solar panel delivers 36 watts, which is plenty for most jobs
cons: Solar panel's angle is not adjustable for best sun exposure

customer_reviews.title: High-Quality Fan With A Slight Hum
customer_reviews.text: Serious air volume attic fan. High quality product and easy to install. The only downside it that it has a metal fan, so it does make some noise when it is sunny. I can tell how sunny by the pitch of the noise. It is not loud, but it can be definitely heard throughout the upstairs of the house. Keeps the attic cool and well ventilated. Prior to this fan the attic smelled old and stale. Now it smells like fresh air up there. I live in CA, so the fan is on all year long when it is sunny.
customer_reviews.author: David B.

customer_reviews.title: Works great.
customer_reviews.text: I bought 3 similar fans for my house a couple years ago. I found that my garage needed some airflow after I put a floor in the attic for storage. So I bought another fan from the same company. They all work great. My electric bill is between $50-$80 less than my neighbors in the summertime.
customer_reviews.author: Gary M.

customer_reviews.title: What a Difference!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Super device/ Fan !!! We have always had a hot second floor on our Bi level home, but after this fan was installed the temp inside the attic door dropped 20 degrees. It was near ambient air temp. It was 93 degrees in southern Ohio today and our attic has been known to reach well above 135 degree, so there was a giant temp drop. We tried everything including 5 passive mounted roof vents with no real difference until today. If you put your hands near the ceiling, it was warm to the touch and radiated heat, but not today, and yes we do have insulation. This fan is awesome!!! Thanks, Natural Light
customer_reviews.author: Choochoo

customer_reviews.title: Avoid Go With A More Reputable Brand
customer_reviews.text: Aethetically ugly. Installed and does not work as described. Product is not supported by customer service. Avoid
customer_reviews.author: PW

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic cooling!!
customer_reviews.text: My last solar attic fan from costco failed after only 2 years. This unit has an amazing warranty and was super easy to install. My handyman swapped out the fans in just over 30 minutes. this fan keeps my house nice and cool during the hot California sun. Today was 86 degrees outside and it was a nice 72 degrees inside without using any AC. My AC finally kicked in around 6pm. Great product and i should save enough money in electricity after a year to pay for this thing. Solar attic fans are a must in sunny hot climates!
customer_reviews.author: wcthumper

customer_reviews.title: Ideal Solution to Vent an Attic wirelessly.
customer_reviews.text: Does what it’s meant to do, easy to install, works as advertised. Do your research on install location, follow instructions, make sure you have a smooth operating caulking gun. Note that the top 3 drill holes will be covered by the shingles with no way to find them when screwing down into room, just make sure to caulk everything. The provided caulk is plenty for the job. I also bought the fire and temperature wiring, simple to install and worth it IMO. I live in the NE and have had the fan shut off as temp approached 70 and kick on again later the same sunny afternoon. Love this solution. Attic is cool and no stuffy smell.
customer_reviews.author: PET

customer_reviews.title: Powerful and Extremely Quiet
customer_reviews.text: Hardest part of installation, for us, was just getting up in attic far enough to figure out dead center between a pair of rafters. After that ... piece of cake. So far, so great. Other wimpier versions of this type of fan cost about the same (check the cubic feet ratings).
customer_reviews.author: Crawdaddy

customer_reviews.title: Can not have any part of solar panel blocked at ALL!
customer_reviews.text: Just purchased item and installed today. 1st thing I noticed while installing was if any cloud cover is nearly stops. Also, I would just put my hand over it from two feet above, it would stop running. It must have zero obstruction for it to work. However, when it did run it ran great. With its location on my roof and being that I live in Florida it should have no problem getting enough sun. My only concern now is whether it will hold up to hurricane force winds.
customer_reviews.author: john thomas

customer_reviews.title: Works great, quiet
customer_reviews.text: I bought this fan 3 years ago, thinking I could install it myself, which was kind of crazy. Two people could do it, but it's a bit heavy and bulky for one. I had the house re-roofed and the roofers installed it for free. We are still having heat waves in N CA in October, and the rooms below the fan were noticeably cooler by about 5 degrees. The fan was operating quickly, smoothly and quietly on a sunny day.
customer_reviews.author: Lady MD

customer_reviews.title: I found this one to be the best and I bought it
customer_reviews.text: After some careful research, I found this one to be the best and I bought it. Install was easy. It is quiet, but I can hear it when I intentionally listen for it. I can't hear it otherwise. My A/C kicks on noticeably less. My girlfriend, who was skeptical at the time, noted that the house seemed to remain cooler and the A/C didn't come on as much. This unit stops working when the sun goes down, but your attic isn't getting any hotter at that point, either.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Solar Fan
customer_reviews.text: More than worth the money. Well built product. Total installation was under 2 hours and I have zero experience with attic fans.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install and work great
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install and work great. Everything you need (not including the caulking gun) is in the box. The hardest part is to drag it to the roof. Make sure you: 1. Cover the solar panel with cardboard box before transporting and installing it unless you would like to run the risk of losing your finger. The moment you expose it to the sunlight, the fan kicks off right away. 2. Keep the fan in the box and transport it to the installation location then you can unbox it.
customer_reviews.author: Hung Dang

customer_reviews.title: Arrived defective.
customer_reviews.text: The fan is very high quality materials. However, when I was up on my roof with a hole already cut, I noticed the fan not working. I called the manufacturer, they answered right away which was nice. They were willing to send a new one but I couldn't afford that time. I accessed the wire box for the solar panel to find a soldered wire off. I had to solder the wire back on. Im not great with the solderer so I hope the connection is secure. I let the manufacturer no via email he gave me and I havent heard back in 2 weeks. I will look for a different brand for a second one I will install.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler Hall

customer_reviews.title: Getting another one!
customer_reviews.text: Love it...got a big house 3150 SQ feet. I can walk under the fan and still have 10ft to the fan above me. I can feel the air moving around me. I can tell a difference with it, got rid of the hot spots in the house. I like it so much, just ordered another one. It went through a hailstorm (4 days after install) that did 3K damage to my car. It came away with no damage, according to my roof guy. I am ordering another and I am going to set the panel at a different angle to get full coverage.
customer_reviews.author: Michael C

customer_reviews.title: Great solar fan
customer_reviews.text: Great solar fan, does exactly what they say. would recommend to anyone for the attic cooling issues. I live in FL and I needed this to keep my A/C from running all the time.
customer_reviews.author: Grant  Conry

customer_reviews.title: Useful for keeping the house cool.
customer_reviews.text: Roof ventilation fan is saving me about 10% on my electric bill.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: American quality
customer_reviews.text: I have installed one on each end of my house. They are quiet and very effective. I have seen 20+degree reduction in attic tempiture and we are not even to summer yet. I did construction for years and this is the best built fan I ever installed. If the electrical parts hold up for the 25 years I will be very happy.
customer_reviews.author: tom c

customer_reviews.title: Solar Powered Attic Ventalator ,No wires to plug in...
customer_reviews.text: I like it very much the base is very solid,not thin sheet metal.,cannot hear it run but you can feel the power and hot air discharge..and Humidity in Louisiana .Remove this and you have a nice cold and dry house.lolRemoves more heat when the sun is out than I ever thought ,doing a great job ,Very Easy to install ..recommend thermostat......
customer_reviews.author: William B.

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install and with amazing results
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install and with amazing results. I put two fans on my roof this summer during a heat spell. The evening before it was 88 degrees inside the house at 9 PM. After I installed the fans the next day it was even warmer outside and the house was down to 80 degrees at the same time. It took about 45 minutes to install the fans and there is no wires to run. as soon as you take the fan out of the box it is working.
customer_reviews.author: Orlondo Franci

customer_reviews.title: Great at Cooling!
customer_reviews.text: Just installed one in attic and one in garage. They have reduced overall home and garage temperatures very noticeably. Quiet. Great addition!
customer_reviews.author: Thomas R. Campbell

customer_reviews.title: Very quiet.
customer_reviews.text: Installation was simple. It has only been installed for a month, but works great and pulls a lot of hot air out of my Florida attic. Very quiet, can't hear it running at all.
customer_reviews.author: Lance T

customer_reviews.title: Best attic ventilator on the market
customer_reviews.text: Best attic ventilator on the market. I've put in hundreds over the last 5 years and like them so well I put them on my personal home.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Booker

customer_reviews.title: Nice Unit
customer_reviews.text: Very well made ,in the box is all the materials you need other then the tools, instructions are very easy to follow or if you rather look on youtube there is a video there as well. A 25 year warranty as well, great deal. ,
customer_reviews.author: Donald Dagenais

customer_reviews.title: Works
customer_reviews.text: Had a roofer install it. It works. Keeps the attic cooler. Total benefits have not been realized yet
customer_reviews.author: David B.

customer_reviews.title: Working great.. I see less humidity in the home ...
customer_reviews.text: Working great .. I see less humidity in the home and temps went down .. please do buy thermostats .. very important
customer_reviews.author: Mehul A.

customer_reviews.title: Noticed a difference immediately. It's only been in place ...
customer_reviews.text: Noticed a difference immediately. It's only been in place for a couple of weeks but the house is drastically cooler!
customer_reviews.author: nicole

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Very quiet and does a great job at pulling the heat out of the garage
customer_reviews.author: D.C.

customer_reviews.title: Really sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I had my roofer install two of these. he said they are the most well built he has seen. it really cools off the house. great product.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Nevertheless it appears to be a sturdy fan and works well, is reasonable quiet, and with a good price and great guarantee.
customer_reviews.text: Works well as a garage ventilation fan, the only problem is that it is permanently set with the on off temperatures and these cannot be modified. I purchased the remote controller for an extra $100 or so, which does provide the home power backup for nighttime use, but it doesn't offer any useful controls. A timer would have been great, and/or the ability to set the on/off temperatures. I tried adding an external timer but it doesn't have any effect when the fan is in solar power mode :( Nevertheless it appears to be a sturdy fan and works well, is reasonable quiet, and with a good price and great guarantee.
customer_reviews.author: Norm C

customer_reviews.title: I bought two for my old house with terrible insulation. My AC was never able to keep ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought two for my old house with terrible insulation. My AC was never able to keep up with the Florida summertime heat load until I installed the fans. My house is cooler, AC runs far less often and there is no longer any condensation dripping from the AC vents. Installation was simple and everything you need comes in the box. (except tools) I highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Jon Guenther

customer_reviews.title: They love them!
customer_reviews.text: Installed 2 of these for a client. They love them.
customer_reviews.author: RLP

customer_reviews.title: a quality solar attic fan
customer_reviews.text: bought 2 of these to replace 2 electric powered fans. looks great, they re heavy duty design. should hold up for many years
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Solar exhaust fan.
customer_reviews.text: Had it installed by licensed roofer to vent hot attic here in sunny Florida. Works so well, am adding a second unit.
customer_reviews.author: maddster

customer_reviews.title: Tornado approved
customer_reviews.text: This fan survived a tornado this spring. A good chunk of the roof was missing shingles, this fan remained in place. I made sure it carried over to the new roof. Not much I can say, it does good at venting the attic and is made well.
customer_reviews.author: Jaystein

customer_reviews.title: Very good unit
customer_reviews.text: Works great in sunny Georgia. Make sure to also order the $18 thermostat as it is not included, and attach it before you seal the fan assembly to the roof. Also not the fan runs as soon as the sun hits it.
customer_reviews.author: RandyH

customer_reviews.title: but this fan really helps my second floor feel nice and comfortable
customer_reviews.text: This is my Second fan from this supplier. I moved and I wanted to make sure I had one on my new house. We get a lot more sun and the attic gets warmer, but this fan really helps my second floor feel nice and comfortable. I highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: tdy357w1

customer_reviews.title: easy to install
customer_reviews.text: Solid construction, easy to install. moves hot air out quickly, very quiet, works even on cloudy days. It worked right out of the box
customer_reviews.author: JUAN R. RAMIREZ

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Vent Fan
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install and no electrical hookup. Additional thermostat is a good buy.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Dodds

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: excellent product. easy to install but thermostat add-on is a must.
customer_reviews.author: Eddie W.

customer_reviews.title: Powerful and quiet
customer_reviews.text: Easy replacement of dead existing solar vent and more powerful and quiet
customer_reviews.author: Allen Erkert

customer_reviews.title: Pull Out Lots of Air
customer_reviews.text: Works like it is advertised to do. I pulled it out of the box and the sun hit it an a second later it was going to town! It took about an hour to install. I did not even have to go into the attic. Installed it from roof. Looking forward to savings this summer. If it works well, I will install in all my rentals. Oh yes, it got to me in 3 days -- regular shipping even!! These guys are quick!!
customer_reviews.author: B. Gonzales

customer_reviews.title: WOW
customer_reviews.text: My installer was blown away with the quality of this fan. The moment he took it out of the box it started working.
customer_reviews.author: Marsha Dale

customer_reviews.title: Must Have for 2-story homes
customer_reviews.text: Significant reduction of heat buildup in the attic after it was installed. Also noticed centralized cooling was more consistent temperature-wise when measuring air coming out of the vents.
customer_reviews.author: Eugenio L. Sabalburo

customer_reviews.title: Worth the cost for these fans.
customer_reviews.text: I have just had my roof replaced due to hail damage, I had the roofer install the solar fans. They have been working great in reducing the heat in my attic.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Gallegos

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Have 2 of these for a 5500Sq. ft attic space, they work well
customer_reviews.author: Crazyleggs

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the price and looks beautiful on my roof
customer_reviews.text: Well worth the price and looks beautiful on my roof. Keep my house about 8 degrees cooler saving $$$$ on electricity.
customer_reviews.author: flsunsets

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I wanted
customer_reviews.text: This solar vent fan is working great! Air conditioner is running less and house feels cooler. Now I just need to wait and see how the 25 year warranty works.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Tarr

customer_reviews.title: Solar panel is EXTREMELY sensitive and must have 100% sun
customer_reviews.text: While the fan works, the solar panel is EXTREMELY sensitive to sunlight. The panel MUST HAVE full sun or the fan will not work at the max wattage. If there are any clouds, the fan throttles back and slows down. Not what I expected for the 400+ price tag. On a positive note, when there is full sun and the unit runs at full capacity, it is extremely effective and works well at reducing indoor temperatures (and in turn decreases the need to run A/C). If you purchase, just be aware of the need for full direct sunlight as again, if it’s cloudy or overcast... it doesn’t run at full capacity
customer_reviews.author: Steph

customer_reviews.title: Great Unit
customer_reviews.text: Everything seems to be working fine, the unit is really meeting all expectations and it has proven to be very cost effective. thank you
customer_reviews.author: Unhappy Camper

customer_reviews.title: Excellent deal
customer_reviews.text: Work as I imagine. Really takes out the attic heat and the best part, no energy cost. 😃😃
customer_reviews.author: Juan B.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great item my AC runs about 30% less during day.
customer_reviews.author: Alan Butterworth

customer_reviews.title: Pays for itself and more
customer_reviews.text: Working great. In addition to another fan and attic foil, after two months of use, I have saved 15% on my electric bill.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great attic fan
customer_reviews.text: Great attic fan, but wish that the automatic thermostat was standard and not an extra charge. Who doesn't need an auto cut off once the attic cools down?
customer_reviews.author: R. C.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Excellent performance keep my house cooler during the hot days. Highly recommended you won’t be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Tro Badillo

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing, seems to work great, don't know if it saves electricity but it works as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: RomeoOG

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Nice product, fit in existing roof vent hole. My husband installed it himself.
customer_reviews.author: sandra r.

customer_reviews.title: Great fan.
customer_reviews.text: The solar attic fan is great. It works well and keeps my attic cooler.
customer_reviews.author: Snowgofer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: This works great! Quiet, powerful and pays for itself. Even when it's not running it works because it's a vent for extreme heat to escape. Must get the thermostat with it though. Easy to install with the right tools. The thermostat regulates it so you don't have to be there to turn a switch. Best part is that it uses the the sun for free energy!
customer_reviews.author: Sean Kennedy

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works excellent. Keeps my garage cool on those hot days.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very happy so far.
customer_reviews.text: Installed the fan this summer. I live in Texas and my attic was very hot. When the sun is shining and it's mid summer the fan will be turning, fast. It's speed is very dependent on the sun intensity. Overall, I am very happy with the amount of air this fan draws from my attic. I am not sure what I save in energy cost, but it definitely removes a lot of hot air. Fast shipping, easy install. I followed the directions and has no issues.
customer_reviews.author: c grif

customer_reviews.title: Only one month. Jacksonville, Florida.
customer_reviews.text: I've only had it for one month so can't really review on performance yet, but I can tell you that shipping from the company was quick and in great shape. The installation was easy, especially if your not afraid of heights. I'm not a roofer, just your ordinary homeowner. Just follow the instructions, simple as that. After the install I did notice it started really spinning and pulling some air and it was around 70+ and sunny that day, so that's good. I bought two so hopefully it will pay off.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Baldwin

customer_reviews.title: Good investment.
customer_reviews.text: I bought a 30 watt for my portion of the house and a 20 for my mom, it really works for me, the cold water lines that goes into attic doesn't burn my hands anymore. ....
customer_reviews.author: Sam Aghajanian

customer_reviews.title: great product. Saw a difference as soon as it ...
customer_reviews.text: Delivered as promised,great product.Saw a difference as soon as it was installed.
customer_reviews.author: Tommy G

customer_reviews.title: Cooool!
customer_reviews.text: Really Cool. Saved already on cooling power wise this month compared to last year, And for temperature compared to last year on this month is hotter than last year. 25 dollars difference this year. Love this Attic fan. Worth the dollars to put it in. Will pay itself in the next year or maybe less of course.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin S

customer_reviews.title: I highly recommend this product
customer_reviews.text: I highly recommend this product!! This is my second attic solar system and it's very helpful when Los Angeles hit 100 degree heat wave (which is very rare temp) this unit helps a lot! very cozy inside the house no matter what temp outside...in addition if you really wanna cool off including the garage put styrofoam 1/2 insulation in door garage which is only $8.99/slab and home depot will cut the size for you! then it solve the heat problem around the house. This unit alone already save you a lot of energy costs with 25-yrs warranty is a plus!
customer_reviews.author: Esther Collins

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Looks good and operates quietly.. Excited to see how much it will save on my power bill.
customer_reviews.author: Lindsay Kupfer

customer_reviews.title: needs more work on thermostat mounting!
customer_reviews.text: seems to work ok, however if you order the thermostat control you have to figure a way to mount it. They don't mount it for you. I used duct tape but I have no idea f the tape will last 20 or 30 years, it seems to be a weakness and it shouldn't be left up to the customer to engineer an item that costs so much. weak design!
customer_reviews.author: electronics guy

customer_reviews.title: solar attic fan
customer_reviews.text: I have it mounted on my roof. I had to cut sofits, but air is flowing well thru the attic now. I can tell that my upstairs is cooler. I will wait till the heat of summer to comment again.
customer_reviews.author: SteveJ

customer_reviews.title: HOT Attic Fix
customer_reviews.text: Works fine, makes a noticeable difference in the attic temperature and costs nothing to run!
customer_reviews.author: RC Flyer

customer_reviews.title: Had my roofer install them as my roof is 15 ...
customer_reviews.text: Had my roofer install them as my roof is 15 years old and did not want any mistakes. Moves a LOT of air when in full sunlight, and that's when it is needed most!
customer_reviews.author: Mike Meyn

customer_reviews.title: Love that it's powered by the sun
customer_reviews.text: House was much cooler after its installation. Love that it's powered by the sun.
customer_reviews.author: CC

customer_reviews.title: bulky
customer_reviews.text: Is very bulky, and my attic only reduced the temperature 5 degrees, before i put it i see temperatures as high 135, when is 94 outside, with the vent the temperatures down to 130, when is 94 outside, is very quiet, looks like a Chimenea cap, i like the other that are low profile, not this one.
customer_reviews.author: Gtz

customer_reviews.title: Works!!!!
customer_reviews.text: put it in, it always works when the sun it out. What else is there? I have owned this for about 2 years.
customer_reviews.author: Big Russ

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Seems very well built and silent. Installers complemented on build quality and performance. Working flawlessly so far.
customer_reviews.author: PeterB

customer_reviews.title: I gave it 5 stars although I don't know how ...
customer_reviews.text: I gave it 5 stars although I don't know how it will work out during the summer, time will tell.
customer_reviews.author: Inez

customer_reviews.title: It was also a bit pricy but i am overall satisfied with the
customer_reviews.text: This product has performed well however, it didn't come with a thermostat which I had to order separately. It was also a bit pricy but i am overall satisfied with the product
customer_reviews.author: Andre Kohn

customer_reviews.title: I guess it works and best for a small attic
customer_reviews.text: Had it installed. Not noisy. I guess it works and best for a small attic. Get it with the thermostat for automatic on and off.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Seigel

customer_reviews.title: so far so good. Have the whole summer ahead
customer_reviews.text: Have only had it installed for about a week , so far so good . Have the whole summer ahead .
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Solar Attic Fan
customer_reviews.text: This solar attic fan works very well, and as advertised. It is easy to install. And, it operates very quiet.
customer_reviews.author: Terry L Operchuck

customer_reviews.title: Serves a purpose but has little impact
customer_reviews.text: My attic is still very hot and the fan does not lower my overall house temperature. I still have to turn on my AC the same amount of time. Perhaps I need another fan at the opposite end of my house. The fan is nice to have because at least some ventilation is moving through the attic, but not sure if this will resolve any problems you may have during the summer months.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse T.

customer_reviews.title: Cool It
customer_reviews.text: The fan was as-advertised - one piece metal housing (builder put in plastic) with large solar panel and 5-blade fan. Installation was easy except for the inability to drive screws under the shingles. I used 3 screws and caulked abundantly with the caulking provided. I was able to use the existing hole which was 15 x 17". There was another passive vent nearby, which I covered (inside the attic) with plastic to encourage drawing of hot air from the attic, not just through the adjacent vent. It got cool shortly after installation so I cannot check for effectiveness, any more than I can check for durability or validity of the warranty at this time. I have faith.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Tibbetts

customer_reviews.title: Worth it with incentive
customer_reviews.text: Weve had it in for about a week. Easy install. Definitely want to use the separate thermostat control ($10 here on amazon) to keep it from running in the winter. Noticed cooler attic temps first day. We put our outdoor themometer up there that wirelessly gives us a temp reading and so far its running about 20 degrees cooler. Attic is close to 2000 sq ft with a metal dark roof. Very quiet.
customer_reviews.author: lily

customer_reviews.title: Great Buy
customer_reviews.text: New roof with these fans. Installation was great. working perfectly
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: Still going
customer_reviews.text: I bought this over two years ago and it is still running. I can tell the difference in my electicity bill as well.
customer_reviews.author: Nothanksx

customer_reviews.title: Very powerful
customer_reviews.text: These solar fans have 30 wats of power. Better than Costco or Home Depot. I already had an electric one in place. Sinse putting two of these up the electric one barely goes on. It is set for 115 dg.I have an extremely large attic. I could tell the difference immediatly.I'm in Los Angeles where it's very hot. If you're in a hot area, I recommend these highly.
customer_reviews.author: Martin A. Breitstein

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product!
customer_reviews.text: These fans were relatively easy to install following the instructions provided and are operating well. They are pulling quite a bit of hot air from our attic, making a noticeable difference in the temperature within our garage and causing our air conditioning units not to run as much to cool the inside of our house. The construction of these attic fans seems to be good and the units are very substantial. We can hear no noise within the house from the fans operating. We are very well satisfied with the product.
customer_reviews.author: Grumps

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: i DO NOT FEEL ANY DIFFERENT i WAS GOING TO BUY ANOTHER ONE BUT CHANGED MY MIND
customer_reviews.author: George Hiowo

customer_reviews.title: Great fan during the daylight hours, but ...
customer_reviews.text: Great fan during the daylight hours, but ... when the sun starts to set, nothing. I suppose its still okay in Arizona where the desert gets cold at night, but here in the northeast, it stays hot into the night due to humidity. Talked at length with the distributor and the manufacturer to see if they had back up to switch over to ac current or battery. No was the answer. So now I am stuck with trying to figure out how to solve problem myself. This should not be since fan cost 3 times as much as traditional electrical fan and it comes with 25 year warranty!
customer_reviews.author: Linda

customer_reviews.title: Can't see any different.
customer_reviews.text: I just spend all this money for nothing, it supposes to handle more than 2,500 sq ft. homes, my house is 1800 sq ft. and I cant see any different.
customer_reviews.author: M. Ramos

product_meta.title: Solar Attic Fan 36-watt - Black - with 25-year Warranty - Florida Rated by Natural Light
product_meta.description: Solar Attic Fans are easily installed on pitched Fiberglass-Asphalt Shingle roofs and are a great product for proper attic ventilation. Natural Light brand solar attic fans are top rated by builders and are of the highest quality built in the USA. The DC motor is powered by the included 36-watt solar panel with the attic fan motor moving hot air and moisture out of the attic space everyday during full sun hours. Solar panel is adjustable from flat up to 45 degree angle.. Solar Attic Fans mount on 3/12 to 12/12 pitch roofs. (this unit is not for flat roofs or side wall mounting - Flat roof mount models are available). Moves up to 1628 cubic feet per minute under full direct sun. Use one attic ventilation fan for every 2625 square feet of attic space. Note: Optional Thermostats and Fire Safety Switches are sold separately. For installations on Tile roofs optional Turret extension and Tile Roof Flashing kits are sold separately. Made in USA.
feature_bullets: Industry Leading 25-year limited warranty on entire unit.
Highest quality materials in any Solar Attic Fan on the market.
Easily installed with No wiring required.
Optional snap-on thermostat for use in colder climates (sold separately).
